title: How was {{petName}}'s day?
intro: Let's take a moment to reflect on {{petName}}'s day. Adjust the sliders to indicate how {{petName}} is doing in each area.
hurtInfo: Is {{petName}} painfree? Or can {{petName}}â€™s pain be successfully managed?

hurtOptions.title: Severe Pain
hurtOptions.description: {{petName}} shows clear signs of pain, like whimpering or difficulty moving, and can't seem to get comfortable.

hurtOptions.title: Moderate Pain
hurtOptions.description: Shows some discomfort, especially when moving or breathing, might avoid being touched in certain areas.

hurtOptions.title: Mild Pain
hurtOptions.description: {{petName}} seems slightly uncomfortable at times but can still rest and move without too much trouble.

hurtOptions.title: Occasional Discomfort
hurtOptions.description: Rare signs of discomfort, mostly able to move and rest without issues.

hurtOptions.title: Pain-Free
hurtOptions.description: {{petName}} is comfortable, moves easily, and shows no signs of pain.

hungerOptions.title: Refuses to Eat
hungerOptions.description: {{petName}} won't eat anything, even their favorite treats.

hungerOptions.title: Struggles to Eat
hungerOptions.description: Shows interest in food but has difficulty eating without assistance.

hungerOptions.title: Eats with Encouragement
hungerOptions.description: Eats only when encouraged or hand-fed, but not eagerly.

hungerOptions.title: Eats with Minor Issues
hungerOptions.description: Eats less than usual or prefers soft food, but generally manages on their own.

hydrationOptions.title: Refuses to Drink
hydrationOptions.description: Won't drink any water, showing possible dehydration signs like lethargy, dry gums, and a dry nose.

hydrationOptions.title: Needs Assistance to Drink
hydrationOptions.description: Shows interest in water but can only drink when helped.

hydrationOptions.title: Drinks a Little
hydrationOptions.description: Drinks on their own but less than usual, might need reminders.

hydrationOptions.title: Drinks with Encouragement
hydrationOptions.description: Drinks a sufficient amount, though might need some coaxing or prefer certain ways of drinking.

hydrationOptions.title: Hydrated and Healthy
hydrationOptions.description: Drinks regularly without any issues, maintaining good hydration.

hygieneInfo: Is {{petName}} clean and comfortable? Is {{petName}} able to keep himself clean?

hygieneOptions.title: Severely Unkempt
hygieneOptions.description: {{petName}} is often dirty, might have matted fur, and frequently soils themselves.

hygieneOptions.title: Needs Frequent Help
hygieneOptions.description: Can sometimes stay clean but often needs assistance to avoid lying in waste or staying clean.

hygieneOptions.title: Occasionally Messy
hygieneOptions.description: {{petName}} is mostly clean but may have occasional accidents or need help with grooming.

hygieneOptions.title: Generally Clean
hygieneOptions.description: Stays clean with minimal assistance, may just need help with difficult-to-reach spots.

hygieneOptions.title: Always Clean
hygieneOptions.description: {{petName}} manages their hygiene well, stays clean, and does not soil themselves.

happinessInfo: Does {{petName}} express joy and interest? Is {{petName}} responsive to things around him (family, toys, etc)?

happinessOptions.title: Severely Depressed
happinessOptions.description: Shows no interest in interaction, toys, or activities that used to be enjoyable.

happinessOptions.title: Often Uninterested
happinessOptions.description: Occasionally shows a glimmer of their old self, but mostly disinterested in surroundings or activities.

happinessOptions.title: Mildly Interested
happinessOptions.description: Shows interest in interactions or toys but less than before, enjoys being with family but may tire easily.

happinessOptions.title: Generally Happy
happinessOptions.description: Engages with family and toys, shows signs of happiness, but not as frequently or enthusiastically as before.

happinessOptions.title: Fully Joyful
happinessOptions.description: {{petName}} is responsive, enjoys interaction, play, and being part of the family activities as always.

mobilityInfo: Can {{petName}} get up without assistance? Does {{petName}} feel like going for a walk?

mobilityOptions.title: Immobile
mobilityOptions.description: {{petName}} cannot move on their own at all. They need assistance for every movement and cannot stand up, walk, or change positions without help.

mobilityOptions.title: Severely Limited
mobilityOptions.description: {{petName}} can barely move and needs significant help to stand, walk, or reposition. They might only manage very short distances with support.

mobilityOptions.title: Moderately Limited
mobilityOptions.description: {{petName}} can move a bit on their own but needs assistance or encouragement for longer distances or getting up from a lying position.

mobilityOptions.title: Slightly Limited
mobilityOptions.description: {{petName}} is mostly mobile but shows signs of difficulty with some movements, like climbing stairs or jumping onto higher surfaces.

mobilityOptions.title: Fully Mobile
mobilityOptions.description: {{petName}} moves freely without any sign of discomfort. They can run, jump, and play as they always have, showing no hesitation or difficulty with any movement.

notificationBody: How did {{petName}} do today? Tap here to record their day.
